Specimen Type: Endocervical or urethral swab (rectal, pharyngeal, or conjunctival swab if indicated)
Purpose: To detect and identify Neisseria gonorrhoeae from clinical specimens.
Container: Swab in transport medium (e.g., Amies with charcoal)
Equipment: Selective agar plates (Modified Thayer-Martin/Martin-Lewis/GC-Lect), CO2 incubator (35–37°C, 5–7% CO2), oxidase test reagents, Bacticinerator or loop sterilizer
